lead_paragraph: A federal court has denied the sprinter Justin Gatlin’s appeal to run in the United States Olympic track trials this weekend. The United States Court of Appeals for the 11th Circuit said Thursday that Gatlin had not shown he met the “applicable standard for such an injunction.” Earlier this month, the Court of Arbitration for Sport upheld a four-year ban against Gatlin, the defending Olympic champion in the 100 meters, for doping violations, but he went to federal court seeking to run in trials starting Saturday.
